vector_2d.gloss: a quantity with magnitude and direction in the plane

vector_3d.gloss: a quantity with magnitude and direction in space
vector_3d.exec: lambda x, y, z: (x, y, z)

magnitude_2d.gloss: the length of a vector in the plane

magnitude_3d.gloss: the length of a vector in space

unit_vector_2d.gloss: a vector of length one in the same direction as the original vector

unit_vector_3d.gloss: a vector of length one in the same direction as the original vector

vector_addition_2d.gloss: adding two vectors in the plane
vector_addition_2d.exec: lambda x1, y1, x2, y2: (x1 + x2, y1 + y2)

vector_addition_3d.exec: lambda x1, y1, z1, x2, y2, z2: (x1 + x2, y1 + y2, z1 + z2)

scalar_multiplication_2d.gloss: multiplying a vector in the plane by a scalar

scalar_multiplication_3d.gloss: multiplying a vector in space by a scalar
scalar_multiplication_3d.exec: lambda k, x, y, z: (k*x, k*y, k*z)

dot_product_2d.gloss: the dot product of two vectors in the plane
dot_product_2d.exec: lambda x1, y1, x2, y2: x1*x2 + y1*y2

dot_product_3d.gloss: the dot product of two vectors in space
dot_product_3d.exec: lambda x1, y1, z1, x2, y2, z2: x1*x2 + y1*y2 + z1*z2

cross_product.gloss: a vector perpendicular to two vectors in space

angle_between_vectors.gloss: the angle between two vectors using the dot product
angle_between_vectors.exec: lambda math, v, w: (v[0]*w[0] + v[1]*w[1] + (v[2]*w[2] if len(v)==3 else 0)) / (((sum(c*c for c in v))**0.5) * ((sum(c*c for c in w))**0.5))

projection_scalar.gloss: the scalar projection of vector v onto vector w
projection_scalar.exec: lambda v, w: (v[0]*w[0] + v[1]*w[1] + (v[2]*w[2] if len(v)==3 else 0)) / ((sum(c*c for c in w))**0.5)

projection_vector.gloss: the vector projection of v onto w
projection_vector.exec: lambda v, w: [((v[0]*w[0] + v[1]*w[1] + (v[2]*w[2] if len(v)==3 else 0)) / (sum(c*c for c in w))) * w[i] for i in range(len(w))]
